attributes.action: Fathers who are subject to immigration should be allowed to see their children.
attributes.additional_details: I myself have started this petition to raise awareness of the home office's awful rules and to prevent such practices being used in the future.  I have been married to a man who was not allowed into the UK for a minor mistake made on his visitor application in 2009 as a result he was banned from being with his wife and child in the UK. My life has been in turmoil since this time and to date I still haven't been able to gain any entry into the UK for my husband. Despite representation from barristers his appeal failed.  SIGN this petition and give my husband a chance to be a father to our daughter. Thank you.
attributes.background: The home office are breaking families up and destroying marriages by not allowing immigrants to a right to family life!

rejection.details:
We are not clear whether you would like the Home Office's rules to be changed, or just the way in which they are applied to be changed. 

If you would like a specific change to made to the rules, we could look at a petition about that.
